text: Ernesto "Estoy" Estrada (November 7, 1949 – May 17, 2015) was a Filipino basketball player. A feared outside shooter, Estrada played for San Miguel Corporation in the amateurs and spent eight seasons in the Philippine Basketball Association from 1975-1982 with Royal Tru-Orange, Toyota, where he was part of two championships in 1978, Great Taste and Mariwasa-Honda. Estrada averaged 19.6 points per game in a total of 289 games played and made it once to the PBA Mythical team.Ernesto Estrada, 1970s PBA star, dies at 65 ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Filipino men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from Cebu Category:Sportspeople from Cebu City Category:San Miguel Beermen players Category:Toyota Super Corollas players Category:Great Taste Coffee Makers players Category:University of the Visayas alumni Category:Cebuano people Category:College basketball players in the Philippines Category:Small forwards
title: Ernesto Estrada (basketball)
